channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3044] xkcd - Spirit
[+2365] Why I Don’t Check Voicemail Anymore [Comic]
item.description: Also, it’s 2010. Do you think we can replace the electronic mailbox voice to something a little more human sounding?

item.title: [+2232] I'm sure it's gonna leave a scar [Pic]
[+1921] Rare Lunar Rainbow Over the Beach (PIC)
item.description: This stunning shot captures a rare lunar rainbow, or moonbow. The photographer writes: "Just after 1am in the middle of the night I noticed some geometrical formation in the sky on Fraser Island. I quickly stopped the car and turned off the light. It was then that I realised I am witnessing the rare event....a rainbow at night."

item.title: [+1826] How to Fall 35,000 Feet.....And Survive
item.description: You're six miles up, alone and falling without a parachute. Though the odds are long, a small number of people have found themselves in similar situations‹and lived to tell the tale. Here's PM's 120-mph, 35,000-ft, 3-minutes-to-impact survival guide.

item.title: [+1557] WTF…The Blowjob Taunt? (GIF)
[+1438] Pee-wee Herman Gets An iPad!
item.description: Pee-wee Herman shows his new Apple iPad to the Playhouse Gang!

item.title: [+1327] The iPad is a comedy gold mine [VIDEO]
item.description: the iPad is so stupid that the number of comedy possibilities is just... astounding.

item.title: [+1296] Bring Me Solo And The Wookie
[+1227] Frantic Steve Jobs Stays Up All Night Designing Apple Tablet
item.description: Claiming that he completely forgot about the much-hyped electronic device until the last minute, a frantic Steve Jobs reportedly stayed up all night Tuesday in a desperate effort to design Apple's new tablet computer.

item.title: [+1218] Bunch Of Phonies Mourn J.D. Salinger
item.description: CORNISH, NH - In this big dramatic production that didn't do anyone any good (and was pretty embarrassing, really, if you think about it), thousands upon thousands of phonies across the country mourned the death of author J.D. Salinger, who was 91 years old for crying out loud.

item.title: [+1128] Cameras Roll As Obama Schools GOP
item.description: For roughly an hour and a half, Obama lectured GOP leaders and, in a protracted, nationally-televised question-and-answer session, deflected their policy critiques, corrected their misstatements and scolded them for playing petty politics. So effective was the president that Fox News cut away from the broadcast 20 minutes before it ended.

item.title: [+831] Don't drink, drive, kill someone, drink, post on Facebook
item.description: Here's a tip: if you were convicted of drunk driving and killed your passenger in the process, don't go posting photos of yourself gettin' krunk on Facebook for the whole world to see before your sentencing.

item.title: [+805] Will I get laid on Valentine's Day? [Flowchart]
item.description: Educational guide to the punani on V-day.

item.title: [+792] Miramax Dies: Rest in Peace
item.description: It’s been a slow death, but Miramax dies on Thursday.The New York and Los Angeles offices of the arthouse movie studio owned by Disney will close.

item.title: [+689] FART Now Loading (PIC)
[+634] Google wants to see client addresses in DNS queries
item.description: Google wants to update the DNS protocol so everyone can see at least part of a client's IP address in order to connect it to the closest server. The idea is to keep latency to a minimum by preventing cross-continent connections when possible.

item.title: [+621] 70% of Employers Have Rejected Applicants Over Online Info
item.description: Today is the 4th annual Data Privacy Day. The Microsoft-sponsored non-holiday was created exclusively to raise the public's awareness of major online privacy issues. And to commemorate this most cautious of days, Microsoft has released the results from a recent study that show just how negligent we are when it comes to managing our online image.

item.title: [+620] Scott Roeder convicted of first degree murder
item.description: A Kansas jury deliberated just minutes before announcing it reached a verdict in the murder trial of religious terrorist Scott Roeder

item.title: [+608] 13-, 12-Year Old Charged With Child Porn After Sexting
item.description: Middle school students had been "sexting" each other, authorities say.
